title: Native currency withdraw using send,transfer and call is not working in smart contracts deployed in private network

labels.name: P3
labels.description: Medium (ex: JSON-RPC request not working with a specific client library due to loose spec assumtion)

body:
As a besu user, we have a private network, we have smart contracts deployed and function to withdraw the native currency on the smart contract, function as follows


`function withdrawCurrencyFromContract(address user, uint256 amount) external onlyOwner {
        require(user != address(0), "Address cant be zero address");
        require(amount <= address(this).balance, "Amount exceeds balance");
        address payable _owner = payable(user);        
        _owner.transfer(amount);
        emit CurrencyFromContractTransferred(user, amount);
    }`
    
    
I am getting errors in the private network, but when I run the same contract on the other public test nets (Rinkeby, Ropsten) networks there is no issue with this code. 

### **Steps to reproduce the bug**
1. Deploy any smart contract with the above-mentioned function in it.
2. Send some native currency/token to the smart contract deployed.
3. Try to call this function.

**Expected behavior:**
This should transfer the balance of native currency/token in the contract to the respective address.

**Actual behavior:**
The function call returns the error message as 'Execution reverted'.

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: besu/v22.1.1/linux-x86_64/oracle_openjdk-java-16
* Java version: openjdk 16 2021-03-16
* OS Name & Version: Ubuntu 20.04.3 LTS
* Kernel Version: Linux ip-10-0-100-135 5.11.0-1022-aws 23~20.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Mon Nov 15 14:03:19 UTC 2021 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
* Cloud VM, type, size: [Amazon Web Services t2-large]

### Additional Information
The solidity compiler version used is 0.8.7

Hi there, to help us investigate this issue, it would be great if you could supply a mini repo which we can use to reproduce your scenario. The smart contracts deployed (looks like you're also using OpenZeppelin?), and instructions for how you're sending the transaction to the `withdrawCurrencyFromContract` function. 

Also - what's your besu setup - genesis file, config options - this is the main difference between testnets and your private network.

With execution reverted - you can enable the revert reason to get more info - it could be that the onlyOwner constraint is not satisfied.

Have you tried on other clients eg Ganache or Geth - if the same thing happens on other clients it's not a besu bug.
If you enable the revert reason do you get more info? https://besu.hyperledger.org/en/stable/Reference/CLI/CLI-Syntax/#revert-reason-enabled

Ah - glad you found the issue! Changing the genesis file basically means you're starting a new chain. So you may have to start from block 0 and redeploy your contracts. But then they should work.

One question - was there an example that you followed in setting up this network? Wondering if we need to update some docs to recommend using later milestones.

Actually, we have deployed a few contracts in the production environment, so I think we need to hard fork the network to Istanbul protocol. In that case, do I face any issues later? 

Regarding your question, We followed the genesis file from [here](https://besu.hyperledger.org/en/stable/HowTo/Configure/Consensus-Protocols/Clique/).

yes you can set the istanbul milestone to a particular block ie hardfork, as long as all your nodes have the same genesis that should be fine.

I'll close this ticket - let us know if you have any further issues.
